thread.title: Watch: Dream Theater's John Myung Plays Jaco Pastorius' 'Portrait Of Tracy' Live In Concert [News]
thread.title_full: Watch: Dream Theater's John Myung Plays Jaco Pastorius' 'Portrait Of Tracy' Live In Concert [News]

title: Watch: Dream Theater's John Myung Plays Jaco Pastorius' 'Portrait Of Tracy' Live In Concert [News]
text:
UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 14 hours ago 9 
During the ongoing Dream Theater tour, which sees the band celebrating 25 years of " Images & Words " by playing the classic '92 album in full, the prog champions have added an interesting tidbit to the setlist - Jaco Pastorius' " Portrait of Tracy ." 
Mr. Johh Myung added the tune to the setlist as an introduction to " As I Am " and a tribute to his personal hero. 
"We have a special treat," singer James LaBrie told the crowd during a gig in Zurich three days ago. "This man to my right, Mr. John Myung [crowd goes wild], one of the finest bass players in progressive music, bar none - before he does his thing - we all grow up, we look at people that have inspired us and really motivated us to attain our dreams, our goals. And in each respective instrument, we have these people that we looked up to. For John Myung, it was this incredible bass player by the name of Jaco Pastorius [crowd goes wild yet again], who he's gonna pay a tribute to now." 
You can watch the footage in the embedded player below. Additionally, footage from the show in Rome is also available.
